Description: Redware pottery dish; broken into fragments and used as ostraca; Coptic text; now re-assembled(part of the rim missing).
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.49, pl.38)
Hayes 1997 / Handbook of Mediterranean Roman pottery (fig.25.6)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82637) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82637)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 38:1 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
